page.title: 15BUTTERFLIES.
page.content: The Swallowtail is the largest British butterfly and it is only found in the broads.It flies very fast and high up. It feeds on milk parsley which is only found in the broads.The Swallowtail is yellow with a striking black pattern. It lays single eggs on milk parsley. Young caterpillars are black and white and are often mistaken for birds droppings. The Peacock butterfly is impossible to confuse with any other butterfly.It has reddy-brown wings with large colourful spots.Adults hibernate in winter.Eggs are laid on nettle leaves. The small skipper is a small orange-brown butterfly,with a skipping flight.It looks like a moth because of it's short hairy body and the way it holds itÂ£s wings.
